header.titleText: Football quiz: match the football club to the election results

questions.question: Chelsea, Stamford Bridge
questions.more: Frank Lampard has moved to Manchester but the Tories still reign in Chelsea and Fulham

questions.question: Celtic, Celtic Park
questions.more: The SNP won 50% of the vote in Scotland, picking up all but three of the 59 seats available, including Glasgow East

questions.question: Swansea City, Liberty Stadium
questions.more: Labour won 25 of the 40 seats in Wales, including Swansea East

questions.question: Arsenal, The Emirates
questions.more: Labour won 45 of the 73 seats available in London, including Islington North. The Lib Dems only won one: Carshalton and Wallington

questions.question: Brighton & Hove Albion, Falmer Stadium
questions.more: The Green Party won Bright Pavillion, but the Conservatives won in Brighton Kemptown, where the Falmer Stadium is based

questions.question: Linfield, Windsor Park
questions.more: The Cannabis Is Safer Than Alcohol Party beat the Conservatives in West Tyrone, but the SDLP won in Belfast South, home of Linfield FC

questions.question: Manchester United, Old Trafford
questions.more: Labour won an impressive 53% share of the vote in Stretford & Urmston

questions.question: AFC Wimbledon, Kingsmeadow
questions.more: Ed Davey of the Liberal Democrats had held the Kingston & Surbiton seat since 1997 but he was beaten by the Conservatives last Thursday

questions.question: Ipswich Town, Portman Road
questions.more: Ukip's only MP came from nearby Clacton but Ben Gummer of the Conservatives was victorious in Ipswich

questions.question: Shetland Football Team, Gilbertson Park
questions.more: The Liberal Democrats won one seat in Scotland: Orkney & Shetland
